title: Motion sensor of students horizontal velocity

content.question: A motion sensor is used to create the graph of a student’s horizontal velocity as a function of time as the student moves toward and away from the sensor, as shown above. The positive direction is defined as the direction away from the sensor. Which of the following describes the student’s final position <math alttext="x sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in relation to the starting position <math alttext="x sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> and the student’s average horizontal acceleration <math alttext="a, sub x " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> between <math alttext="0.0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mn>0.0</mn><mtext> </mtext><mi>s</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="3.0 seconds" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>3.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>s</mtext></mrow></math>?

choices.label: Position <math alttext="x sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is farther away from the sensor than <math alttext="x sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="a, sub x " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive.

Position <math alttext="x sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is farther away from the sensor than <math alttext="x sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="a, sub x " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative.

Position <math alttext="x sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is closer to the sensor than <math alttext="x sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="a, sub x " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is positive.

Position <math alttext="x sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is closer to the sensor than <math alttext="x sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="a, sub x " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative.

content.answer: Position <math alttext="x sub f" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is farther away from the sensor than <math alttext="x sub 0" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="a, sub x " overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>a</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> is negative.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
